text: with the *`/crm/v4/objects/{objectType}/{objectId}/associations/{toObjectType}/{toObjectId}`* associations v4 endpoint, is there a way to use the DELETE method to remove only a specific association label by assoc. type id if multiple are present?

Hi all, I'm trying to remove some associations (contact to company) using Make (formerly Integromat) API.

The input bundle is
```[
    {
        "toObjectId": 882329169,
        "definitionId": 5,
        "fromObjectId": 917643530
    }
]```
However, this doesn't seem to do anything within HubSpot. Can anyone suggest what I might be doing wrong or how I can rectify the situation please?

Cheers!

<@U03LVAPQ2DB> What library are you using?

You can't provide both the "value" and the "values" property in your filter section of your request to the search function - you must choose one of them, depending on what filtering you're doing.

I believe "values" is only used when using operator "IN" or "NOT_IN", as they are meant to work with lists of possible values. The rest are meant for single values, and hence you should use the "value" property instead.

The "test" function on the docs site can't be used with this function, afaik, because you can't remove one of them completely - they are both included for clarity in how to format them, but that in itself creates confusion as it breaks the request.
<@U01QVR44MEY> I'm testing from docs - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies>
<@U03FEES92KW> Thanks for your response, you're right docs site creates confusion, but when I'm using the provided PHP code, it also gives syntax error, please check the below image.
Yep, so like Erik said delete either the value or values parameter
Yeah <@U01QVR44MEY>, but syntax error remains same.
So it's looks like you deleted the filters inside of filter_groups
If you don't want those you need to delete 'filter_groups' => [{}], also
I would also suggest that you add some test data like setting query to HubSpot and setting an example property to name
<@U01QVR44MEY> I've added 'filter_groups' as mentioned in docs (please find below image), but syntax error remains same. I'm new in HubSpot, please correct me if I'm doing anything wrong.

Your problem right now is not specific to HubSpot, but rather a coding syntax error in your JSON payload. Just double check your brackets and parentheses and make sure you're formatting the payload correctly. The only thing you want to remove from the sample from the docs site is:

```"values":["string"],```
The rest can be left alone. However, the values in that sample is likely not going to result in anything - there are no standard properties called "string" on the company object, and you most likely don't have any properties with the value "string" set either. So you're gonna want to enter some valid data to search for before you attempt it.

I think I found the correct syntax
```$PublicObjectSearchRequest = new PublicObjectSearchRequest(['filter_groups' => [["filters" => [["value" => "string","propertyName" => "string","operator" => "EQ"]]]], 'sorts' => ["string"], 'Something is wrong' => "string", 'properties' => ["string"], 'limit' => 0, 'after' => 0]);```

Hi, I’m migrating to the new Private Apps from using the API, as documented here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/migrate-an-api-key-integration-to-a-private-app>

I’m running into a problem (see screenshots).
The gist: I’m getting 403 errors from the server saying a required scope is missing, but that scope is added to the private app, as shown in the screenshots.

Any help here diagnosing this would be most appreciated
<@U01QVR44MEY> Thank you so much for the correct syntax, it worked, and also <@U03FEES92KW> thanks for your explanation.

Get rows for a table => <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb>
this code snippet shows: `HubSpotClient.cms.hubdb.rows.rowsApi.getTableRows(...)`
Doing this in a workflow causes an error. we need to remove `rows.` from this:
`HubSpotClient.cms.hubdb.rowsApi.getTableRows(...)`  seems to work for me

Not sure if it is a different version or if documentation is incorrect.  This has cost me quite a few hours this week :disappointed:
